free: #e Hello everybody.
#c 哈囉 大家好。
#e I am to talk about our swing of Rukai.
#c 我要講一個有關我們魯凱鞦韆的事情。
#e Our swing of Rukai is discussed very much.
#c 我們魯凱的鞦韆很常被談起。
#e So (the swing) is often talked about, there would be (people) mention this
#c 所以(鞦韆)常常被談起，有人會談到這個。
#e The ways to say swing are different.
#c 鞦韆的說法都不一樣。
#e And our swing
#c 然後我們的鞦韆呢，
#n 此句是不完整句 (Ecliptical sentence, EC)
#e There are swings of Rukai.
#c 魯凱族有鞦韆。
#e There are swing of Paiwan.
#c 排灣族有鞦韆。
#e But (they) are different.
#c 但 (他們)不一樣。
#e The swing of Paiwan would name tuma.
#c 排灣的鞦韆會叫做Tuma。
#e Then this swing in Rukai would name talasi.
#c 然後這鞦韆在魯凱會叫做talasi。
#e The swing in Paiwan, (We) say the swing of Paiwan tuma.
#c 那個排灣的鞦韆，排灣的鞦韆叫做tuma。
#e Rukai’s swing is meaningful.
#c 魯凱族的鞦韆是有意義的。
#n 確認nidarepanekuvai.的意思。
#e Swing can not be swung by yuorself at will.
#c 鞦韆不能自己隨便盪。

gloss: 名物化-自己-<重疊>盪鞦韆-名物化

free: #e During harvest festival, when harvest, man will do their mission, and women swing for seven days.
#c 當豐收的時候，豐年祭的時候，男人做任務，女人盪鞦韆，要花費七天。
#n Ku 的功能要再確認。
#e The swing, why (we) would say (it) important?
#c 這個鞦韆，為什麼(我們說)(它)這麼重要呢?
#e After these girls go swinging, there are spirits in swings.
#c這些女孩去盪鞦韆之後，鞦韆變的有生命。
#n IRR(非實現) 跟其後 mu-a(實現)的衝突在自然語料很常見。

gloss: 名物化-心智-名物化=2SG.屬格

free: #e Especially when (the girl) is swinging, the spirit of the swing will tell you heart and ask your heart to be decent.
#c 尤其當那個(女孩子)在盪鞦韆的時候呢，鞦韆的靈氣會告訴妳的心，叫妳的心要正直。
#e When the girl is swinging, (she) can’t just hang there.
#c 當那個女孩子在盪鞦韆的時候，(她)不能只是吊掛在那兒。
#n 這裡可以看出來在講者的心中 mua是不定式，要實現必須加wa-。
#e There is meaning in swinging method.
#c 盪鞦韆的方式是有意義的。
#e There are bending knees and changing angle needed when (one) swings.
#c 盪鞦韆的時候需要屈膝和變換角度。
#e Girls who swing beautifully are decent.
#c 盪鞦韆盪得很漂亮的女生，是善良的。
#n 要跟老師確認。我想應該是「那鞦韆會叫(你)去(變)善良。」
#n 要跟老師確認。我想應該是「那鞦韆會叫(你)去(變)善良。」
#e If the swing tangles and curves, the mind is not decent.
#c 若鞦韆糾纏和捲曲的時候，心就是不正直的。
#n SI要確認，因為這跟其他的SI都不同。
#e This mistake means that your female friend is not decent.
#c 這樣的錯誤代表了你的女性朋友不是善良的。
#e The tangling is a mistake of oneself.
#c 糾纏是自己的錯誤。

gloss: 被動-實現-重疊-重疊-知道

free: #e Girls needs to learn how to swinging by herself since childhood.
#c 女孩子從小就要開始學習盪鞦韆。

gloss: 名物化-方式-自己-<重複>盪鞦韆-名物化
free: #e When the day of self-swinging comes.
#c 當到了自己盪鞦韆日到的時候。
#e When the day of (girls) self-swinging comes, old citizens will ask yang citizens come to watch.
#c 當到了女孩子自己盪鞦韆日到的時候老人家會叫年輕人來看。
#e All (girl’s) friends will dress in traditional clothes and come to the tribe.
#c 所有(女孩)朋友會穿傳統服裝到部落來。
#e Boys will also (dress in traditional clothes).
#c 男孩也會(穿著傳統服飾)。
#n adravane需確認。
#e Then the boy wear traditional clothes and then help.
#c 然後男生會自己穿傳統服飾然後幫忙。
#e These girls will take turns to swing.
#c 這些女孩將輪流盪鞦韆。
#n balrithi 輪流
#e I say these old.citizen knows; they are watching and they can tell whether you are good or not by how well you change angle and bend your knees.
#c 我說那些老人家知道；他們在看並從你姿勢翻轉和勾腳得好不好就知道你優不優秀。

gloss: 名物化-自己-盪鞦韆-名物化
free: #e When they come home, the parents tell these males whom they saw swinging.
#c 回到家後父母告訴男生剛剛有看到誰盪鞦韆。

gloss: 名物化-方式-盪-名物化=3SG.屬格

free: #e That way she swing reveals her personality.
#c 她那盪鞦韆的樣子呈現她的性格。
#e You go pursuit (her)!
#c 你去追求(她)吧!
#e So, from the way girls swing, it can be known whether they are gentle, bad, or impatient.
#c 所以呢從女生盪鞦韆的姿勢就知道他們是溫柔，壞，還是急躁。
#e When swinging, the women wear traditional clothes and can not let the headwear fall.
#c 當穿著傳統服飾的女士們盪鞦韆的時候，頭飾不能弄掉下來。
#e If the headwear or traditional wear fall, we also say bad lock also comes.
#c 如果頭飾或傳統服飾掉下來，我們也說有厄運會來。
#e Swing, only girls swung by themselves.
#c 這個盪鞦韆，只有女孩子自己才能盪鞦韆。
#n 122 Luka 要再三確認，有很多不同用法。
#e Male can not swing.
#c 男生不能盪。
#e (This) represents the love for females.
#c (這)表示對女生的疼愛。
#e Males, what are you messing around the females?
#c 男生,你在攪和女生什麼？
#e Tell the boys you only need to sway and catch.
#c 告訴男生說你只要搖和抓住就好了。
#e If you swing like girls do, you will be like sissy.
#c 如果你像女生一樣盪鞦韆，你就會像娘娘腔。
#e (This means) you are unable to catch preys and you can not catch fish.
#c (這個意思就是)你沒有辦法打到獵物，你也沒辦法抓到魚。
#e (You will) not be able to work, and you will be soft like girls, and (you) have no strength and (you) can not (work) under sun.
#c (你會)無法工作，你像女孩子一樣軟綿綿、(你會)無力疲憊(而且)(你)又不能曬太陽。
#e Therefore, males can not swing, and (he) can not get especially close to swings no matter what
#c 所以呢 男生不可以盪鞦韆，(他)不管如何都不能特別靠近鞦韆。
#e No matter what, you will be like females, and you do not want to get married.
#c 無論如何，你會像女生，你不想結婚。
#e You will be like a sissy.
#c 你會像個娘娘腔。
#e Old people are very smart.
#c 老人家非常聰明。
#e (We) only swing for seven or eight days; those days passed, (we) can’t swing.
#c (我們)鞦韆只盪七天或八天;那些日子過了(我們)就不能盪鞦韆。
#e (We) keeps telling children that they can not swing at night.
#c (我們)一直跟小孩子說晚上不能盪鞦韆。
#e They said there is a ghost when you swing.
#c 他們說有鬼當你盪鞦韆時。
#n pangepange是專門推鞦韆的鬼。
#e If you swing at night, there will be four hands of pangepange push you beyond the mountain, and then you will be gone.
#c 如果在晚上盪鞦韆，會有pangepange的四支手把你推到山的另一頭，然後你就不見了。
#e (I) think about it, this is a thing to teach children.
#c (我)想一想，這是一件教導孩子的事情。
#e (They) scare (the children) this: if you swing at night, you will fall down and get hurt.
#c (他們)嚇(小孩)這樣：如果晚上盪鞦韆的話，你會跌倒而且受傷。
#e So, I said that swing can only take place at Harvest Festival.
#c 所以，我說呢，鞦韆只有豐年祭才能盪。
#e (We) gather every girl.
#c (我們)集合所有女生。
#e These women swing and ask old citizens, men in the tribe, and their boyfriends who came to watch and enjoy the women.
#c 這些女人盪鞦韆叫老人家和部落的男士，還有前來的男友觀賞與娛樂。
#e Then (it) is like this.
#c 然後都像這樣。

gloss: 名物化-要知道的-名物化=1IPL.屬格
名物化-不同-名物化=1IPL.屬格
free: #e As far as Paiwan is concerned, their swing is erected with wedding gifts in the yard when getting married and being swung by them.
#c 鞦韆在排灣族來說，他們的鞦韆是當結婚時隨著聘禮或嫁妝立在家中的庭院然後(他們才)盪。
#e We need to know our difference (when) there is a swing standing in Rukai.
#c 我們要知道我們魯凱族的不同之處，(當)有鞦韆搭起時。
#e When we talked about Rukai, there is no meaning for swing (when) we get married.
#c 當我們提到魯凱族，鞦韆在我們結婚時沒有意義。
#e (People) say there are swings in Rukai wedding get it wrong.
#c 有人說魯凱族結婚時有鞦韆是弄錯了。
#e Only when Paiwan is engaging, there is a swing.
#c 只有當排灣族人訂婚時，才會有鞦韆。
#n 這裡的鞦韆是排灣語
#e (Now)there is no this paleta tree.
#c (現在)已沒有這種paleta樹。

gloss: 名物化-放-重疊-這個-名物化

free: #e The ancient time for real, there are that big trees for putting and tie this swing.
#c 古時候真正的來說，有那大樹來放置和綁這鞦韆。
#e This swing can be lifted and carried.
#c 這鞦韆可以抬者走也能帶著.
#e (In) the very ancient time, the (swing) will be tie on a very big tree and (can be) carried.
#c (在)很古老的時候，(鞦韆)會被綁在很大的樹上而且能被帶著走。
#e Then it is exactly that this swing is important.
#c 然後就是這鞦韆很重要。

gloss: 當-被動-重疊-知道-名物化

free: #e It is bad that you do not know the manner of swing.
#c 你不知道盪鞦韆的方式是不好的。
#e You are tomboy..
#c 妳是個男人婆。
#n balase是指男女無法進行自己性別所應做的工作者，翻譯時要注重上下文中被指稱之人，選擇合適翻譯。又由於本句常帶責罵意味，故此處翻成男人婆。
#e The tomboy, you are like a man.
#c 這個男人婆，妳就像男生。

#e When you do not know the manner of swing, (you) do not know (how to) weave; (you) do not know (how to) put lazurite; (you) do not know the women’s woman’s work, and then it.is.exactly that you are not responsible.
#c 當妳不知道盪鞦韆的方式，(妳就)不知道(怎麼)織布，(妳就)不知道(怎麼)串珠，(妳就)不知道(怎麼)做女人的工作。
#n 發音人無法辨識。
#n 發音人無法辨識。
#e Why do you marry a tom boy who does not know (how to) take care of family (and) does not know the women’s work.
#c 你幹嘛娶個男人婆不知道照顧家裡(也)不知道女人的工作。
#e We make effort very much and emphasis this swing.
#c 我們很努力然後重視這個鞦韆。
#e I finished.
#c 我(說)完了。
